channel.title: Models
channel.description: Well, I've deleted all of the custom models in my models folder to get rid of all these glitches and useless items...But...(Seeing as the models have been added via add model #### and the "add models" button on my client) they are still there and glitching my objects, npcs, and items. How would I go about removing all of these models?...

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:8, topic:285522”]Would be easiest to just download the client, then just delete your previous cache and paste the Galkon’s one in. Here :
http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?zb3zjctqzlz

You would then have to re type add model a hell of a lot of times.
So i suggest adding the “Add models” command, there’s a tutorial in my big tutorial[/quote]

Got an “Add models” button on my client, auto adds all of em. Thanks for the cache![br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 27, 2009, 01:11:58 am[/size][hr]Got a new cache and everything for my webclient…And edited a few sprites, yet the models are still messed up and the sprites did not change…

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Meh, well you can re add them again if you really want, but i had a few problems with them being stackable when i tried.

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

SilentCJ:

Ah, easy, replace the cache with a very basic one, i used the Galkon’s Base cache when i unglitched my client, as there are not many glitched models in there, the only models that are glitched, are 5 seed models, but hey, who actually uses seeds nowadays.

i use seeds

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Would be easiest to just download the client, then just delete your previous cache and paste the Galkon’s one in. Here :
http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?zb3zjctqzlz

You would then have to re type add model a hell of a lot of times.
So i suggest adding the “Add models” command, there’s a tutorial in my big tutorial

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

SilentCJ:

Ah, easy, replace the cache with a very basic one, i used the Galkon’s Base cache when i unglitched my client, as there are not many glitched models in there, the only models that are glitched, are 5 seed models, but hey, who actually uses seeds nowadays.

Where can I find this? =D (As in, do I need to download his client or does he have a cache download link…)

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“funkytown, post:4, topic:285522”]ive had this happen i think i solved it by changing my client
but i think you jjust undo what you did to put em on too take em off[/quote]

  1. Don’t feel like going making another webclient atm…
  2. When you do…“add model ####” I need to know where to find out where it puts those so I can take them out, as I have already taken the actual models out of the models folder. Just that string on text I need to get rid of I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: Models
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

funkytown:

how are they glithing like are they in the wrong slot ect??..

Chickens wre ags specials, dragons in trees, etc. No real weapon glitches. Just object glitches.
